abstract: Chen Guangcheng, a blind human rights lawyer, is said to have found refuge in the U.S. Embassy in Beijing. Although the diplomatic silence from Beijing and Washington has been deafening, there's something of a precedent for Mr. Chen's situation: Two dissident physicists, wanted by the Chinese authorities in the days after the Tiananmen massacre in 1989, spent 13 months living in the embassy's basement.

headline.main: U.S. Embassy in Beijing Has Been a Sanctuary Before
